title: Incarnation unbanned and added to c9?! Rito pls...
body:
I'm hearing rumours that it has been "confirmed" c9 has recruited incarnation with the removal of Hai as their mid laner...

None of the sources I'm seeing can be proven as reputable, but this person was BANNED permanently from competitive play for DDOSing (something that is a CRIMINAL OFFENSE in most countries and completely ruins the integrity of online events when utilized as a mechanism to ensure victory) but has recently been considered "reformed" and had the ban removed...

Riot, really? 

I'm all for "people change" and such but... really??

replies.body:
Hai wasn't removed. He stepped down from the team and got a new position in C9 in management (Chief Gaming Organizer or some such).

Nothing has been confirmed until it comes from Cloud 9 management. The only thing I have seen about Incarnati0n and C9 was a post that seemed to be an April Fools Day joke. And something from HotShotGG on Reddit saying he couldn't contract him to CLG because he was already signed.

Next, Incarnation has declined any involvement in DDoS attacks of any kind, and since there is no actual proof that shouldn't be held against him. He admits that he was a toxic player (another reason for his perma-ban) but Riot monitored him in a parole type situation and after 6 months found him to be fit for return to playable gamer status (which includes access to competitive League of Legends).

It kind of pisses me off that a permabanned toxic player can get paroled back into their old account if they are a competitive/pro gamer, but if one of us regular folks do the same bannable offenses it's "tough shit, make a new account and stop being a jerk".

Hey, they are toxic but successful, where as common folks are only toxic :D

I know of 3 non-Pro/Competitive players that have been "reformed" by Riot and given their old accounts back. Their review of banning practices only changed 6~months ago.

If you know someone that was perma-banned have them re-contact Riot and attempt to be "reformed" if they are interested.
I actually really want to see CLG Incarnati0n.
Won't happened Incarnati0n is already signed (With who we do not know), from what HotshotGG is telling people.
go to Cloud9.gg and he's listed as C9's midlaner.

Thank you for replying to a comment 3 weeks after the fact.

You have truly helped the "Past Me" from pointing out that CLG Incarnati0n can't happen because he was already signed.

I can only assume you meant to tell Rhlax this information.
dat necro. But I suppose it's relevant.
So if someone has shown very good behaviour for 2 years youll still hold things he did in the past against him?

Speaking hypothetically since I am unsure if these allegations are proven or not, but If someone DDOSed a tournament match to help their own side win, that person should be permanently deleted from the game's competitive scene, probably the entire game altogether, REGARDLESS of how long ago the event took place.

Not holding grudges is fine for things like "He was being kind of a prick", but some things you can't ever allow yourself to forget the person did them. If someone DDOSed a tournament, then forgive them if you wish, but never EVER trust them again.
